{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3492596,"name":"Nathan W","username":"NameTag","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nametag/{size}/218265_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-25T20:32:18.657Z","cooked":"

Our team (5013) is trying to use MegaTag2 with Phoenix’s progenerated CommandSwerveDrivetrain for pose estimation. Every time we run the code below, which is inside an encapsulation subclass, we get CAN errors. From what I can tell, mt2 initialized correctly, but accessing it or using any of its methods leads to a fatal error and breaks the robot. Any help or ideas would be much appreciated.

Code:
@Override
public void periodic() {
// This method will be called once per scheduler run
doRejectUpdate = false;

CommandSwerveDrivetrain drivebase = RobotContainer.getInstance().getDrivetrain();

LimelightHelpers.SetRobotOrientation(name, drivebase.getRotation3d().getAngle(), 0, 0, 0, 0, 0);
LimelightHelpers.PoseEstimate mt2 = LimelightHelpers.getBotPoseEstimate_wpiBlue_MegaTag2(name);
//if(Math.abs(drivebase.getPigeon2().) > 720) // if our angular velocity is greater than 720 degrees per second, ignore vision updates     //{
//  doRejectUpdate = true;
//}
if(mt2.tagCount == 0)
{
  doRejectUpdate = true;
}
if(!doRejectUpdate)
{
  drivebase.addVisionMeasurement(
      mt2.pose,
      mt2.timestampSeconds);
}

}

The error message as shown on driverstation:

What version of Limelight OS are you using? What version of Limelight Helpers?

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":4,"updated_at":"2025-01-25T20:47:19.541Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":4,"reads":113,"readers_count":112,"score":42.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":483610,"topic_slug":"using-megatag2-with-phoenixs-commandswervedrivetrain","display_username":"Joe Ross","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":true,"admin":false,"staff":true,"user_id":65,"hidden":false,"trust_level":4,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/using-megatag2-with-phoenixs-commandswervedrivetrain/483610/2","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3492677,"name":"Benjamin Hall","username":"bhall-ctre","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bhall-ctre/{size}/198180_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-25T22:26:46.405Z","cooked":"

I see a couple issues going on here.

First, I see CANcoder configs and signal fetches failing. Are your CANcoders actually on a bus called “Canivore” (note that it is case-sensitive), and are they running the latest 2025 firmware? Additionally, do their LEDs look correct, and are they on a 12 V power source?

From there, it’s possible for the returned mt2 object to be null, so you have to null check. There are also a couple of issues with grabbing the robot heading. I would look at our SwerveWithPathPlanner Robot.java to get an idea of how to integrate vision with our swerve API.

Lastly, our swerve API expects a different timebase than the FPGA time provided by Limelight and PhotonVision. We’ve updated the generated project (in the next Tuner X release) and our examples to add this code to the end of CommandSwerveDrivetrain, so you’ll want to copy that into your CommandSwerveDrivetrain.

Thanks for the help! As it turns out, all four CANcoders on the drivetrain became unplugged, with caused mt2 to return null and cause all the problems. After plugging them back in, the code ran without errors.
